titleInfo.title: USA v. Schamp
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting Oral Motion to Continue as to Leonard Samuel Schamp (1).The change of plea hearing is continued from today to August 18, 2006 at 1:00 p.m. before the undersigned magistrate judge in Courtroom 2, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska.For this defendant, the time between today's date and the hearing on the anticipated plea of guilty is excluded for purposes of computing the limits under the Speedy Trial Act. See 18 U.S.C. 3161(h)(1)(I)&(h)(8)(A)(B). Defendant shall appear at the hearing. Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 8/10/2006. (CS, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Schamp
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER that defendant's unopposed oral motion to continue is granted and the change of plea hearing is continued to November 8, 2006 at 1:00 p.m. before the undersigned magistrate judge in Courtroom 2, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska. The ends of justice will be served by granting such a motion, and outweigh the interests of the public and the defendant in a speedy trial, and the additional time arising as a result of the granting of the motion, the time between today's date and the anticipated plea of guilty, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act, for the reason that defendant's counsel requires additional time to adequately prepare the case, taking into consideration due diligence of counsel, the novelty and complexity of the case, and the fact that the failure to grant additional time might result in a miscarriage of justice. 18 U.S.C. 3161(h)(8)(A)&(B). Defendant shall appear at the hearing as to Leonard Samuel Schamp (1). Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester.(CS, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

The ends of justice will be served by granting such a motion, and outweigh the interests of the public and the defendant in a speedy trial, and the additional time arising as a result of the granting of the motion, the time between today's date and the anticipated plea of guilty, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act, for the reason that defendant's counsel requires additional time to adequately prepare the case, taking into consideration due diligence of counsel, the novelty and complexity of the case, and the fact that the failure to grant additional time might result in a miscarriage of justice. 18 U.S.C. 3161(h)(8)(A)&(B). Defendant shall appear at the hearing as to Leonard Samuel Schamp (1). Ordered by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester.(CS, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Schamp
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Revised Presentence Investigation Report as to defendant Leonard Samuel Schamp. It is ordered that: (1) The defendant's motion for departure regarding overstatement of criminal history 36 will be resolved at sentencing. (2) Except to the extent (if at all) that I have reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects. ETC. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Revised Presentence Investigation Report as to defendant Leonard Samuel Schamp. It is ordered that: (1) The defendant's motion for departure regarding overstatement of criminal history 36 will be resolved at sentencing. (2) Except to the extent (if at all) that I have reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects. ETC. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Schamp
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Leonard Samuel Schamp (1) - Defendant pleaded guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 84 months, followed by 4 years supervised release with special conditions, and pay $100 Special Assessment. Count II is dismissed on the motion of United States as to defendant Leonard Samuel Schamp. Defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons before 2:00 p.m. no earlier than 60 days from today's date as notified by the U.S. Marshal. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (4 certified copies to USM)(CS, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to Leonard Samuel Schamp (1) - Defendant pleaded guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a term of 84 months, followed by 4 years supervised release with special conditions, and pay $100 Special Assessment. Count II is dismissed on the motion of United States as to defendant Leonard Samuel Schamp. Defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons before 2:00 p.m. no earlier than 60 days from today's date as notified by the U.S. Marshal. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (4 certified copies to USM)(CS, )
